goserver.game.board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • goserver.game.board.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores an array for go board, handles move possibility and consequences i.e. updates the board after move.
    Author:
    mk

    • Method Detail

      • checkIfMovePossible

        public MoveState checkIfMovePossible(Color c,
                                     int x,
                                     int y)
        Checks if move of given color to given coordinates is possible. Checks if given field is empty, if move wouldn't be suicidal and if ko rule wouldn't be violated.
        Parameters:
        c - Color of the Stone player wants to put
        x - first coordinate of the stone.
        y - second coordinate of the stone.

      • putStone

        public void putStone(Color c,
                     int x,
                     int y)
        Puts a stone of given Color to given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        c - Colour of the Stone to put on board.
        x - first coordinate of the stone.
        y - second coordinate of the stone.

      • getFieldType

        FieldType getFieldType(int x,
                       int y)
                throws FieldOutOfBoardException
        Gets FieldType of the Field of given coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - first coordinate of the field.
        y - second coordinate of the field.
        Returns:
        FieldType of the Field of given coordinates.
        Throws:
        FieldOutOfBoardException - when given coordinates are out of board.

      • getField

        Field getField(int x,
               int y)
        Gets the Field of given coordinates.
        Parameters:

        y - second coordinate of the field.
        Returns:
        Field of given coordinates.

      • isOnBoard

        private boolean isOnBoard(int x,
                          int y)
        Checks if given coordinates are on board.
        Parameters:
        x - first coordinate to check.
        y - second coordinate to check.
        Returns:
        true if (x,y) is on board, false otherwise.
